TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class ActivationObject : Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject, Microsoft.JScript.IActivationObject
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ActivationObject extends Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject implements class Microsoft.JScript.IActivationObject
Public MustInherit Class ActivationObject Inherits ScriptObject Implements IActivationObject
public ref class ActivationObject abstract : Microsoft::JScript::ScriptObject, Microsoft::JScript::IActivationObject

Docs.summary: Represents an object that is taking part in a scope hierarchy. This class contains methods for resolving scope and for getting member information. It belongs to the compilation and run-time state category.

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that describe the attributes of a field. is added automatically.
Docs.summary: Creates a new global variable, using the specified name, value, and attributes.
Docs.returns: A global variable that has the specified name, value, and attributes.

Docs.summary: Stores an array of variables that are in scope.

Docs.summary: Gets the current default scope, which is either the contained object of a statement scope, or the global scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Reflection.FieldInfo GetField (string name, int lexLevel);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Reflection.FieldInfo GetField(string name, int32 lexLevel) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetField (name As String, lexLevel As Integer) As FieldInfo
public: virtual System::Reflection::FieldInfo ^ GetField(System::String ^ name, int lexLevel);

Docs.param: The name of the field to search for.
Docs.summary: Returns a field that has the specified name by searching the scope hierarchy. This method searches only the scope that is specified by the lexical level.
Docs.returns: A object that has the specified name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method applies to fields that cannot be resolved at compile time. This occurs when an `eval` expression refers to a field in the outer scope. Because the `eval` expression can declare a local field that has the same name as a field in the outer scope, the field cannot be early bound to the outer scope field.

Docs.summary: Gets the global scope by searching the scope hierarchy until it finds a scope that includes static variables, for example, a module scope.

Docs.summary: Gets the local declaration of a field that has the specified name. This is used at compile time for error checking.
Docs.returns: The local declaration of the field.

Docs.param: The name of the member to search for.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies how the search for members is conducted by reflection.
Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of objects that correspond to all members that match a specified name.
Docs.returns: An array of objects that match the argument.

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies how the search for members is conducted by reflection.
Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of objects that corresponds to all members of the current object.
Docs.returns: An array of objects that contains all members of the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetMemberValue (string name, int lexlevel);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetMemberValue(string name, int32 lexlevel) cil managed
Public Function GetMemberValue (name As String, lexlevel As Integer) As Object
public: virtual System::Object ^ GetMemberValue(System::String ^ name, int lexlevel);

Docs.param: The name of the member to search for.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of the specified member by searching the scope hierarchy. This method searches only the scope that is specified by the lexical level.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method applies to members that cannot be resolved at compile time. This occurs when an `eval` expression refers to a member in the outer scope. Because the `eval` expression can declare a local member that has the same name as a member in the outer scope, the member cannot be early bound to the outer scope member.
